page.title: 13RELIGION: QUINTON
page.content: The parish{church of St. Swithin is at the heart of the original farming community, and is surrounded by many charming timber frame and other historic houses. Atop the sandstone nave, the 40 metre,ribbed spire dominates this part of the village.{Origins of the church go back to at least Saxon times.The fabric of the church is considered most valuable. The thriving congregation keep the church alive as a centre for village life. Villagers of all types worship together regularly. The village school and other village groups also use the church as a focal point throughout the year. The present incumbent also ministers to the soldiers at Long Marston.
